content:
Posted: November 4, 2014
												Some things I notice right away - The performance is terrible. My machine well meets the recommended requirements and I still get ~20 frames per second on medium settings. There's no traditional tutorial, at least not in the sense of reading instructions and then practicing, which is practical in a flight sim. It's easy enough to keep the plane flying straight if you have a flight stick, but for any casual player who's using mouse and keyboard, it'll be difficult to keep the plane from nose diving while reading instructions all at a horrible frame rate. Even the highest setting for graphics looks horrible. Enough said. I could rant more about this, and struggle to find redeeming characteristics, but I think I've hit the criteria which are necessary for a video game to be enjoyable. Please don't buy this.

number of helpful: 26 of 30 people (87%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: January 25, 2015
												This could be a great little casual game if it was actually finished. It is not a true flight sim and to prove it, there is no support for customising controls and if you are lucky enough to have a flight controller, you will find the throttle is useless. I could not even find a button to accelerate at all, so ended up using a gamepad. Controlling the planes is not that bad at first though they always seems to be turning left a little . The starting plane seems to lack lift and is constantly falliing. Its not really an issue until you try to bank sharply, and find yourself falling too fast to do anything. The second plane on the other hand is always climbing. Again not to bad except for the fact it is extremely slow and climbing slows it further. It struggles to get enough power to climb when taking off, which is bad considering the number of runways surrounded by hills. the constant climbing also prevents it building enough speed to finish many of the timed missions. The third plane is the worst so far. The rate of climb is so severe it makes landing difficult. the amount of force you need to counter it is also likely to give some side input. the problem there is that this plane is also very responsive making it incredibly hard to fly straight. This means that landing are ridiculously hard, trying to counter the uplift and land straight so as not to run into something or roll. I have yet to unlock the fourth plane, but already dreading it. One thing they all have in common, is a useless rudder. Pressing it will turn you only a few degrees, no matter how long you hold it. When you release it you will  have to endure some wild swaying back and forth until it settles close to the direction you started.The graphic of the game are pretty basic but FPS sux, badly. With the game only using maybe 20% of my CPUs capacity, and GPU barely registing any use, I can only get an average of 11fps even on lowest settings and smaller resolution. Higher detail was barely worth the 4fps I ws getting. The only major differnce was on lower settings I could actually see things through the clouds at 300metres, that completely block visibilty on high detail. For those not familiar with the metric system, that is damn low, under the minimum legal flight altidude in many countries. So having no visiblitly of anything on the ground makes it damn hard to land. Night time, which is somehow 14hrs long,  has a similar problem. In this case though it is more from lack of design. Fair enough you cant expect lights in the middle of nowhere, but some runways have drum barrels that remain unlit, and base runways have power and still no lights. Not even the buildings have lights.The games missions are something I really like. There is a good variety and you are given a choice of three at a time. Even here though there are some issues. The worst being some timed missions are too short for the capabilities of the second plane. Another annoying set are ones requiring you to go though a series of waypoints to your destination. Thats fine if you are taking tourist sight seeing, but why do I have to fly in a needless zigzig when someone needs something urgently. Even worse, why do I have to fly the whole zigzag on the return trip? To make it worse quite a few waypoints are hidden behind mountain. Isnt the idea to set way points to avoid obsticles? Also they are white and set at 300m. The exact altidude to be hidden by clouds, which seem to always be around. A lesser complaint would be the fire fighting missions. You fly through a series of waypoints and drop something on the fire when prompted. Exactly what you drop and how you can drop it multiple times is something left up the imagination it seems.I did enoy playing this game at first, but the bad hadling mixed with pathetic fps made it more of a chore flying the third plane. Add in the terrible night landings and hidden/useless waypoints and I honestly cannot recommend the game in its current state.

By: Charley Tank




Okay so I took this Screenshot 10-02-16 on high settings with an i7 6700k 16GB of DDR4 Ram and an Xtreme Gaming GTX 980 Ti 6 GB video card and only what 54 FPS I don't know what I was thinking when I wrote this review on this game before, I did recommend it and after playing it on this system and only getting 54 FPS I had to change my entire thought process. the controls alone are kinda bad okay they are bad it's not the normal keyboard controls it's weird I couldn't control it what so ever. so I hooked up an Xbox 360 controller and it got a little better maybe 12% but this game is pretty unplayable on my i5 4690K 32GB of Ram with an Xtreme Gaming GTX 970 and I can play the crap out of a lot of games with this PC but on this game it's pushing 16 FPS on High 22 on low. I would not Recommend this game unless you have a super computer and like crappy controls.

Posted: February 2
												I probably got this game from a bundle somewhere. I decided I should at least give it a shot, and the first mission or so seemed moderately playable (not good, but at least playable) as long as I didn't have to turn. I got about halfway through the second mission (the missions have lengths in the vicinity of 50 km when you're flying at 250 km/hr, so it sounds like you can expect 12 minutes of tedious and terrible flying for one chance to do anything else), dropped some antidote off at a drop point (luckily I didn't have to land), and was contemplating actually giving this game a bit more of a shot. Then my plane promptly decided to nosedive into a hill.I don't think there's any redeeming factor here.
